data.text: @SenRickScott @POTUS Our elections are not rigged or stolen. We are a laughing stock because we have a buffoon as POTUS and the Legislature is useless. The Republicans refuse to fulfill their Constitutional responsibilities as a check and balance. #uselesssenator

@SenRickScott @POTUS Please fact-check this claim:

Under the SAVE Act, a driver’s license or REAL ID alone is not sufficient to register to vote; voters must provide documentary proof of U.S. citizenship (passport or birth certificate). 

Only ~48% of Americans have passports. 

Voters who changed
@SenRickScott @POTUS Solving for a problem that doesn’t exist Republicans are going to lose in the midterms, no matter what

@tlb1232 @LarryBoorstein @SenRickScott @POTUS Thanks for the note. In New Hampshire, strict photo ID is indeed required to vote in person. In Connecticut, voters can use non-photo ID or sign an affidavit if no ID is available—photo isn't mandatory. Experiences may vary based on polling practices. For details:
@grok @LarryBoorstein @SenRickScott @POTUS In NH and CT we had to show ID
@SenRickScott @TheLeoTerrell @POTUS Even with it passing, states like Georgia and Arizona have multiple ways to sell an election to the highest bidder.
